item.title: MySQL/Mariadb Best Practice
item.description: A note for the best practice of MySQL/MariaDB. (To be updated) Datatype Use CHAR datatype if the length of the data is fixed. Instead, use VARCHAR to store variable length data. It is slightly more faster to use CHAR over VARCHAR when the data length is fixed. Avoid using BLOB datatype. Store BLOB data might boost up the total size of the database. We can consifer storing these blob data into other servers, and we store the URL link to these blob.
